alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF LOWER YAMPA RIVER BASIN... EASTERN UINTA BASIN...TAVAPUTS PLATEAU...AND EASTERN UINTA MOUNTAINS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 234 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 13 miles east of Manila to 36 miles east of Sunnyside and moving east at 20 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This squall will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Lower Yampa River Basin, Eastern Uinta Basin, central Tavaputs Plateau and southeastern Eastern Uinta Mountains Counties. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 3. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 127 and 174. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 353 and 380. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 2, and between mile markers 4 and 5. Colorado 318 between mile markers 3 and 7. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
